intro: Erigeron peucephyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, which give it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are usually pale blue to lavender in color and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
